page.title: 12 Trevecca Farm.
page.content: Mr.Wills farms Trevecca farm which has 143 acres and is opproximately 200 years old. Only 100 acres of land are actually farmed and rest is marsh and woodland. Ten acres of barley is grown for winter feed and the rest is grass. On the farm there are 2 heifers, 1 steer, 280 ewes, 350 lambs and 6 rams. Most of the work is contracted out.On the farm is a derelict cottage with no access, water, gas or electricity. It has been empty for 20 years and had been used by a farm worker. Just by the cottage there is an old wall and the land on the other side of it comes right to the top of the wall. This was the site of an old Quaker meeting house and burial ground. Also on the farm there is an old cider press made mostly of wood. At the beginning of the century one of the fields was the refuse tip for Liskeard.
